channel.title: INsmh
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INsmh, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Plan to 'change sickness benefits checks' to slash the welfare bill
item.description: Ministers are planning to ramp up the number of routine checks on sickness benefits claimants as Chancellor Rachel Reeves looks at ways to cut the wel...

item.title: Man With The Golden Arm dies aged 88 after saving lives of 2,400,000 babies
item.description: James Harrison saved millions of lives by donating his extremely rare blood plasma.

item.title: Man Accused Of Swallowing $770K Worth Of Diamonds From Florida Tiffany's
item.description: Jaythan Gilder allegedly asked jailers, “Am I going to be charged with what’s in my stomach?”

item.title: Chicken lays anus clenchingly massive egg
item.description: The whopper took five hours to deliver

item.title: The unusual psychic technique used by the MoD to try and find Osama bin Laden
item.description: 'It was a classic low probability high consequence situation, in that even if people were skeptical, the impact of any successes would be huge.'

item.title: Why UK's longest-serving prisoner Hannibal the Cannibal is locked inside a glass cell 23 hours a day
item.description: As serial killer Robert Maudsley goes on hunger strike, the Mirror looks at Britain's longest-serving prisoner's lonely life in his 'prison inside a p...

item.title: Northern Lights: Met Office reveals where to see Aurora Borealis TONIGHT - best spots
item.description: The Met Office has revealed the parts of the UK that could witness the Northern Lights tonight and intense solar activity may mean the lights are visi...

item.title: This is why an entire town plays a brutal 16-hour football game on Shrove Tuesday
item.description: Shrovetide ball games have been played in England since Henry II was on the throne.

item.title: 'The pain is excruciating - a long death terrifies me, it's only a matter of time'
item.description: Assisted dying campaigners have shared their emotional accounts of life with a terminal illness, as the Isle of Man is set to become the first place i...

item.title: Pokémon-Shaped Cheeto Sells At Auction For Whopping $87,840
item.description: Sixty people attempted to buy the "Cheetozard," a Cheeto shaped like the beloved Pokémon Charizard, during an auction on Sunday.

item.title: Former CIA agent claims there was life on Mars and he saw ‘bones’ on the surface
item.description: 'It [was] obvious these people were dying for some reason, but they were humans. They were just twice our size.'

item.title: Fears UK 'mimicking Elon Musk' with civil service plan - 'not a good look'
